rdf:Description.rdfs:label: device id
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to provide an unique identifier for a device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment group
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class is used to identify the different kinds of equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Device
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A device is a material element or assembly of such elements intended to perform a required function.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ip address
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The IP address of the device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An equipment is any single apparatus or set of devices or apparatuses, the set of main devices of an installation, or all devices necessary to perform a specific task.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Device elements
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class is used to represent the elements that compound a device.

The 'Equipment, devices and apparatus' ontology module represents data about any single apparatus or set of devices or apparatuses, the set of main devices of an installation, or all devices necessary to perform a specific task.
rdf:Description.dc:title: Equipment, devices and apparatus ontology
rdf:Description.terms:creator: Javier Cuenca <mailto:jcuenca@mondragon.edu> Felix Larrinaga <mailto:flarrinaga@mondragon.edu>

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Device configuration
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: In computers and computer networks, a configuration often refers to the specific hardware and software details in terms of devices attached, capacity or capability, and exactly what the system is made up of.
